stories.title: Credit-card firms are becoming reluctant regulators of the web
A short summary of Chapter 1 of Software Engineering at Google

stories.text:
Hy What advices you have for a product pre-PMF ? All I know pre- PMF is that you have to run experiments. We are iterating our product based on the few requests we had so far.

I've launched at the beginning of the month on PH. We got about 200 new users. No upwards trend. [Product] Ikuna - Create a personalised, 3-sec launchable workspace for every project. All your tabs and apps coming together exactly the way you want them to.

And lastly, thank you for clicking on my post. It means you either know something about PMF or are interested in the comments. Both ways, welcome.
stories.title: Pre-PMF Looking for feedback or advice

stories.text:
Hello, I am a developer and most companies I worked for offer a "learning budget" you can spend on videos, courses, conferences relative to your job to keep your skills sharp. I have always appreciated the benefit but I have always had trouble finding good quality material. What do you guys suggest is a good way of spending this money?

I liked uncle's Bob videos (https://www.cleancoders.com/) and found some good courses here as well https://ui.dev/.

Do you have any other suggestions?
stories.title: Best resources to spend company's learning budget on?
